data.title: Movie/TV News
data.meta_description:
MONDAY, MAY 27

FURIOSA: A MAD MAX SAGA---the prequel earned about $27 million in its three-day premiere compared to FURY ROAD's $45 million in 2015.

STAR...
data.text:
MONDAY, MAY 27

FURIOSA: A MAD MAX SAGA---the prequel earned about $27 million in its three-day premiere compared to FURY ROAD's $45 million in 2015.

STAR WARS---George Lucas was surprised to be presented an Honorary Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival by Francis Ford Coppola on the 47th anniversary of STAR WARS. Lucas said, “What an honor it is for Francis to appear out of nowhere. I didn’t expect this. He’s a great friend, and a big brother, and a mentor, and I thank him for everything he’s ever done for me. I’d like to thank the Cannes Film Festival, which [Walter Murch,] my co-writer, sound editor, great pal, who came to the Cannes Film Festival… My first professional movie [THX 1138] was shown here 52 years ago, in the first director series. It was pouring rain, and it was one of the greatest moments of our life. We had to sneak into the movie because Warner Bros. wouldn’t have much to do with us. This is a great circle moment.

I can’t thank all of you enough. I’m just a kid who grew up in a vineyard in Modesto, California, who makes movies in San Francisco with my friend Francis. So we spent our entire careers in parallel, and in San Francisco in particular. In fact, I’ve never made a Hollywood film as a director. So it’s a real honor to be here. I can tell you that. Thank you so much."

Later, Lucas said that after he sold Lucasfilm to Disney for $4 billion in 2012, Disney wandered away from his original concepts, “I was the one who really knew what STAR WARS was…who actually knew this world, because there’s a lot to it. The Force, for example, nobody understood the Force. When they started other ones after I sold the company, a lot of the ideas that were in [the original] sort of got lost. But that’s the way it is. You give it up, you give it up.”

He also commented on his controversial revisions to the original movies, “I’m a firm believer that the director, or the writer, or the filmmaker should have a right to have his movie be the way he wants it. We did release the original one on laserdisc and everybody got really mad, they said, ‘It looks terrible.’ And I said, ‘Yeah, I know it did’. That is what it looked like.”

JURASSIC WORLD---a rumor claims new cast members for the dinosaur reboot movie include Tobin Bell (SAW) and Joel McHale (COMMUNITY).

FALLOUT---the Amazon Prime tv series based on the video game had 1.5 billion viewing minutes from April 22-28 which made it Amazon Prime's biggest premiere ever and its only series to make AC Nielsen's top streaming list three times.

THE LAST OF US---Jeffrey Wright will play Isaac, leader of the Washington Liberation Front, in Season 2.

MARVEL CINEMATIC UNIVERSE---Giancarlo Esposito said he will star in a Marvel Studios tv series, "The MCU has knocked on my door and it’s a role you won’t predict. It will be teased and there will be a series afterwards.”

Also, a rumor claims Esposito's BREAKING BAD co-star, Bryan Cranston, has met with Marvel Studios to discuss his appearing in a future Marvel project.

DEATH BY LIGHTNING---Michael Shannon will star in the Netflix miniseries about the assassination of President James Garfield.

MY BLOODY VALENTINE---Blumhouse is reportedly make a new version of the 1981 slasher movie, but it is not known if it is a sequel or a reboot.

TRIVIA---Memorial Day trivia.

In THE GREAT ESCAPE, Steve McQueen played Captain Virgil Hilts, an American pilot who was a key part of the Allied POW escape attempt from the German Stalag Luft 3 POW camp. Hilts's character was based on several different POWs, but director John Sturges said Hilts was based mainly on Capt. David. M Jones. Jones was a B-25 Mitchell bomber pilot and a member of the Doolittle Raid, which bombed Tokyo four months after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor which led to the US entering World War II. Jones was bombing a German airfield in Tunisia when he was shot down and captured. He was a POW at Stalag Luft 3 for two and half years and, because of his leadership abilities, was chosen to be a leader for the digging team on Harry, one of the three tunnels in The Great Escape.

Jones said after The Great Escape was discovered by the Germans, the Germans released a list of the POWs who were captured and executed, "...had a lot of good friends on it...some people I met when I first got to camp, worked with, lived with...it was a very traumatic time..."

He added, "There were 78 prisoners who actually escaped, three were very successful, escaped. All the rest were collected by the Germans and of that, 50 were murdered."

In THE GREAT ESCAPE, Steve McQueen played Captain Virgil Hilts, an American pilot who was a key part of the Allied POW escape attempt from the German Stalag Luft 3 POW camp.

Director John Sturges said Hilts was based mainly on Capt. David. M Jones (second from left), a B-25 Mitchell bomber pilot and a member of the Doolittle Raid, which bombed Tokyo four months after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

Jones's Stalag Luft 3 POW card.

TUESDAY, MAY 28

STAR TREK: DISCOVERY---trailer released for the last season.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0w5aEr8rzQs

WOLFS---teaser trailer released for the movie starring George Clooney and Brad Pitt.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wcm-oSv1mNs

WAKE UP DEAD MAN: A KNIVES OUT MYSTERY---Cailee Spaeny (PRISCILLA) and Josh O'Connor (THE CROWN) will co-star with Daniel Craig in the Netflix sequel. Rian Johnson posted, “I love everything about whodunnits, but one of the things I love most is how malleable the genre is. There’s a whole tonal spectrum from Carr to Christie, and getting to explore that range is one of the most exciting things about making Benoit Blanc movies.”

He added, "We’re about to go into production on the third one, and I’m very, very excited to share the title, which gives a little hint of where it’s going.”

SPIDER-MAN 4---Bilall Fallah, who co-directed the cancelled BATGIRL with Adil El Arbi, commented on rumors they are directing SPIDER-MAN 4, "I can't talk about that."

FURIOSA: A MAD MAX SAGA---George Miller said he has finished a Tinted Black and Chrome version of FURIOSA, “We’ve done it already. It’s the last thing I did on this film, and I call it Tinted Black and Chrome. I must say, it’s really interesting, I’m still trying to demystify why the black and white, for me, has something more elemental to it. I still can’t put my finger on it. It’s not because they look like old black and white movies, it’s something else. It’s like if we took a picture of ourselves right now, it might look a little more dramatic if it’s in black and white.”

MARVEL CINEMA UNIVERSE---George Lucas said Martin Scorsese has changed his mind slightly about the MCU after he criticized Marvel movies in 2019, “Look. Cinema is the art of a moving image. So, if the image moves, then it’s cinema. I think Marty has kind of changed his mind a little bit.”

DAVID LYNCH---David Lynch hinted at a surprise project, “Ladies and gentleman, something is coming along…. for you to see and hear. And it will be coming along on June 5.”

I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER---Jennifer Love-Hewitt said she is in talks to return for the latest sequel, ”It’s in the cooker, let me just say that. I’ve done a couple of preliminary phone calls. I keep getting these messages from people going, ‘We’re so excited!’ I’m like, ‘Okay, but the train is moving really fast, and I haven’t gotten there yet.’ But it’s nice to know that people are excited at the possibility. Honestly, it’s wild to even think about. Truly, if it comes together, I don’t even know how I’m gonna feel except extremely overwhelmed and grateful."

TRIVIA---Steve Reeves became Europe's highest-paid actor after starring in the 1958 hit Greek mythology movie HERCULES. When the producers of the first James Bond movie, DR. NO, were looking for the actor to play Bond, they offered the role to Reeves, but he declined the offer because he did not want to be tied down to a multiple-movie franchise.

If Reeves had accepted the James Bond role, ironically, he would have reunited with Luciana Paluzzi, who appeared in HERCULES as Iole's maid in HERCULES and in THUNDERBALL as SPECTRE assassin Fiona Volpe.

Steve Reeves became Europe's highest-paid actor after starring in the 1958 hit Greek mythology movie HERCULES and turned down the James Bond role in DR. NO.

If Reeves had accepted the James Bond role, ironically, he would have reunited with Luciana Paluzzi, who appeared in HERCULES as Iole's maid (left-top photo) and in THUNDERBALL as SPECTRE assassin Fiona Volpe (bottom photo).

WEDNESDAY, MAY 29

WOLFS---trailer released for the comedy movie starring George Clooney and Brad Pitt.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6sGIOY8TBs

KINDS OF KINDNESS---trailer released for the comedy movie starring Emma Stone.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r0x8IDtrUmA

MOANA 2---trailer released for the sequel starring Dwayne Johnson.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qkgkUCqEum4

A FAMILY AFFAIR---trailer released for the Netflix comedy movie starring Nicole Kidman and Zac Efron.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ytc2eifpiuQ

LORD OF THE RINGS: THE RINGS OF POWER---photo released of Rory Kinnear playing Tom Bombaldi in Season 2.

THE MUMMY---Hollywood insider Daniel Richtman claims Universal Pictures is developing a prequel to THE MUMMY, “The Mummy PREQUEL movie now in development at Universal with Wes Tooke (Midway, The Rescue) writing the script.“ It is not known if it will be a prequel to the 1932 movie starring Boris Karloff or the 1999 remake starring Brendan Fraser. However, Comicbookmovie.com claimed it will be a prequel to the Brendan Fraser remake. In 2023, Fraser commented on returning as Rick O'Connell, “I’m not opposed to it, I don’t know an actor who doesn’t want a job. I don’t think I’ve been this famous and unsalaried at the same time in my professional life so sign me up!”

MAD MAX: THE WASTELAND---George Miller commented on the status of his next Mad Max movie, “I’d say that it certainly has a lot of action in it, but it is also a saga. It’s a year-long story. FURY ROAD happened over three days and two nights. You could almost say that the first act, some part of the second act, and the third act mostly play in real time. Quite a different kettle of fish than FURIOSA."

He added, "I’m still figuring out what to do with [THE WASTELAND]. I’m just waiting to see the reception on FURIOSA. If it all lines up, then we’ll go ahead with it.”

NOSFERATU---Bill Skarsgard commented on his vampire character Orlock in the remake of the 1922 movie, “I do not think people are gonna recognize me in it. He’s gross. But it is very sexualized. It’s playing with a sexual fetish about the power of the monster and what that appeal has to you. Hopefully you’ll get a little bit attracted by it and disgusted by your attraction at the same time.”

TRIVIA---Jean Marsh is best known for her Emmy Award-winning performance as maid Rose Buck on the British tv series UPSTAIRS, DOWNSTAIRS. Marsh's first US appearance in a major network show was THE TWILIGHT ZONE episode "The Lonely" where she played Alicia, the robot companion to James Corry (Jack Warden), a man convicted of murder and sentenced to solitary confinement on a desolate asteroid.

Jean Marsh is best known for her Emmy Award-winning performance as maid Rose Buck on the British tv series UPSTAIRS, DOWNSTAIRS

Marsh's first US appearance in a major network show was THE TWILIGHT ZONE episode "The Lonely" where she played Alicia, the robot companion to James Corry (Jack Warden), a man convicted of murder and sentenced to solitary confinement on a desolate asteroid.

THURSDAY, MAY 30

WAKE UP A DEAD MAN: A KNIVES OUT MYSTERY---Glenn Close, Jeremy Renner and Kerry Washington are the latest co-stars to join Daniel Craig in the Rian Johnson/Netflix sequel.

STAR WARS---THE ACOLYTE showrunner Lesleye Healand commented on fan criticism that THE ACOLYTE is excessively female-dominated, “As a fan myself, I know how frustrating some STAR WARS storytelling in the past has been. I’ve felt it myself.”

She later added, “I stand by my empathy for STAR WARS fans. But I want to be clear. Anyone who engages in bigotry, racism, or hate speech … I don’t consider a fan.”

Lucasfilm head Kathleen Kennedy commented on the fan criticism of THE ACOLYTE's female cast and crew, "My belief is that storytelling does need to be representative of all people. That’s an easy decision for me.

Operating within these giant franchises now, with social media and the level of expectation — it’s terrifying. I think Leslye has struggled a little bit with it. I think a lot of the women who step into STAR WARS struggle with this a bit more. Because of the fan base being so male dominated, they sometimes get attacked in ways that can be quite personal.”

THE LORD OF THE RINGS: THE HUNT FOR GOLLUM---Viggo Mortensen said he has not heard any details about the plot of THE HUNT FOR GOLLUM, but he might be interested in returning as Aragorn, “I would only do it if I was right for it in terms of, you know, the age I am now and so forth. I would only do it if I was right for the character. It would be silly to do it otherwise.”

THE EXORCIST---Mike Flanagan is the writer/director/producer of a "radical new take" standalone sequel to the classic 1973 movie.

YOUNG SHERLOCK HOLMES---THE MINISTRY OF UNGENTLEMANLY WARFARE team of Hero Fiennes Tiffin and director Guy Ritchie are reuniting for the Amazon Prime tv series based on the novels about 19 year-old Sherlock Holmes.

JUST CAUSE---Angel Manual Soto (BLUE BEETLE) will direct the movie based on the video game.

MASTERS OF THE UNIVERSE---Nicholas Galitzine will play He-Man in the reboot movie.

MINECRAFT---Netflix animated tv series underway based on the video game.

TRIVIA---Showtime's DEXTER was based on the Jeff Lindsay novels about Miami Police Department forensic blood splatter analyst Dexter Morgan, who also was a vigilante serial killer. Lindsay based Dexter Morgan on Brazilian serial killer Pedro Rodrigues Filho, who was 14 years old when he killed the deputy mayor of a Brazilian city who fired his father, a city security guard, after he claimed Filo's father was a thief. He then killed the security guard who was the real thief. Filo later joined a gang where he killed rival gang members, including an entire gang whose members killed his pregnant girlfriend. Filho was sent to prison for 34 years for committing 71 murders, but he claimed he killed over 100 people and only killed people who were criminals themselves. While in prison, Filho killed over 40 fellow inmates.

After being released from prison, Filho became a star on YouTube and TikTok. Following the success of Showtime's DEXTER, Filho became known as "The Brazilian Dexter". He was killed in drive-by shooting in 2023.

FRIDAY, MAY 31

WHAT REMAINS---trailer released for the murder movie starring Stellan Skarsgard.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RW_DYUFyUZw

CAPTAIN AMERICA: BRAVE NEW WORLD---a source claims Giancarlo Esposito will appear in BRAVE NEW WORLD as a character described as an “antagonistic agent of chaos” and “a serious thorn in Sam Wilson’s side.”

JURASSIC WORLD---Mahershala Ali is in talks to co-star with Scarlett Johansson in the sequel.

TOP GUN 3---producer Jerry Bruckheimer commented on the status of the sequel, "We had preliminary stuff. We're not there yet. [There's] ways to go."

NATIONAL TREASURE 3---director Jon Turteltaub was asked about the chances of a sequel starring the original cast, “100%. … We do have to hurry because people are both getting older and less interested and lives are changing and all that. And the world changes. Our culture is changing. A lot. Since the first movie was made. Socially, certainly politically, and definitely, our language, and different cultural changes we’ve had. And you’ve got to make sure you’re in touch with all that and moving with it, and doing things the right way. … It’s not as easy to just do another one. You’ve got to take a lot into account. I can tell you, 20 years later Justin Bartha is a lot better looking.“

WAKE UP DEAD MAN: A KNIVES OUT MYSTERY---Mila Kunis is the latest cast addition to the Rian Johnson/Netflix sequel.

CRIME 101---Barry Keoghan is in negotiations to co-star with Chris Hemsworth and Mark Ruffalo in the Amazon MGM Studios movie based on the novella. The novella synopsis says, “It’s a great crime story in the vein of HEAT. High-level jewel thieves are taking place up and down the Pacific Coast, and police have linked the thefts to the Colombian cartels. Detective Lou Lubesnick has other ideas, and he zeroes in on one perp, a thief looking for a final score.”

TRANSFORMERS---Chris Hemsworth is in talks to star in the untitled TRANSFORMERS and G.I. JOE crossover movie.

WELCOME TO DERRY---Bill Skarsgard confirmed he will return as Pennywise the Clown in the IT spinoff tv series.

HACKS---Max renewed the series for Season 4.

TRIVIA---in TITANIC, James Cameron explained how he made the Titanic's set appear much bigger than it really was and saved on the budget at the same time, "We only cast short extras so it made our set look bigger. Anybody above 5’8”, we didn’t cast them. It’s like we got an extra million dollars of value out of casting."

MONDAY, JUNE 3

VENOM: THE LAST DANCE---trailer released for the sequel.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=__2bjWbetsA

RETURN TO SILENT HILL---trailer released for the horror sequel.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U-a9Opfwi0w

STAR WARS: THE ACOLYTE---the NEW YORK TIMES reported that THE ACOLYTE's budget is $180 million for eight episodes ($22.5 million per episode). This makes it the second-most expensive STAR WARS tv series with ANDOR costing $250 million for 12 episodes ($20.8 million per episode).

300---Zack Snyder is in talks to direct the Warner Bros Television series based on the 2007 movie that starred Gerard Butler. There is speculation it will be a prequel to the movie.

GAME OF THRONES---George RR Martin commented on screenplay writers who make movies that are unfaithful to the original book, “If anything, things have gotten worse. Everywhere you look, there are more screenwriters and producers eager to take great stories and ‘make them their own.’ It does not seem to matter whether the source material was written by.

No matter how major a writer it is, no matter how great the book, there always seems to be someone on hand who thinks he can do better, eager to take the story and ‘improve’ on it.

‘The book is the book, the film is the film,’ they will tell you, as if they were saying something profound. Then they make the story their own. They never make it better, though. Nine hundred ninety-nine times out of a thousand, they make it worse.”

AVENGERS: SECRET WARS---Anson Mount commented on rumors he will appear in the sequel as Black Bolt from the INHUMANS tv series, “This is so interesting. Please tell us more about this contract I apparently signed in my sleep. I’m so curious to hear all the juicy details from a feed that is clearly not a click-farm.”

SPIDER-MAN---after Sony Pictures announced it will increase its use of AI in movies and television to reduce costs, producer/writer Chris Miller said no AI will be used in the Spider-Verse, “There is no generative AI in BEYOND THE SPIDER-VERSE and there never will be. One of the main goals of the films is to create new visual styles that have never been seen in a studio CG film, not steal the generic plagiarized average of other artists’ work.”

LIFE ON OUR PLANET---Netflix is developing an untitled "next iteration" of the documentary series which will focus on the dinosaurs, “where they came from, why they mattered, how they evolved and how they met their ultimate fate.”

Showrunner Dan Tapster said, “This series, covering 170 million years, will immerse viewers in the awe-inspiring world of dinosaurs, capturing the majesty and drama of their lives in unprecedented detail.” The series also includes mammals, invertebrates, plants and other life forms. Morgan Freeman returns as the narrator.

TRIVIA---Fess Parker achieved stardom in Walt Disney's hit DAVY CROCKETT three-episode tv series. Disney originally wanted James Arness to play Davy Crockett and watched Arness in the giant ant sci fi movie THEM!, but Disney was more impressed with Parker playing an airplane pilot who told the FBI agent played by Arness that he saw flying saucers which were really the giant ants in flight. Parker said, "The picture was reviewed by Walt Disney because Jim Arness was already starring in motion pictures, and he was the star of this film...And Disney just happened to see that part of the film and said, 'Who's that?' and no one knew." Eventually a THEM! producer was contacted, who gave Parker's name to Disney. Parker added, "That was my lucky break because he just saw a minute or two of film."

Playing an airplane pilot led to Parker's stardom, but ironically, during World War II, Parker enlisted in the Navy with hopes of becoming a pilot, "I'm 6' 6" and I tried to fly, tried to be in the Naval pilot program and the Army program. 6' 4" was the height limit." His height also prevented him from being a Naval radioman/gunner. Parker then became a radio operator on a minesweeper in the Pacific Theater when the war ended.

Fess Parker achieved stardom in Walt Disney's hit DAVY CROCKETT three-episode tv series.

Disney originally wanted James Arness to play Davy Crockett and watched Arness in the giant ant sci fi movie THEM!, but Disney was more impressed with Parker (center) playing an airplane pilot who told the FBI agent played by Arness (right) that he saw flying saucers which were really the giant ants in flight. Ironically, during World War II, Parker enlisted in the Navy with hopes of being a pilot, but his 6" 6" height made him too tall to be a pilot.

TUESDAY, JUNE 4

SNOWPIERCER---trailer released for Season 4.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KA_Lq-GjelA

LAND OF WOMEN---trailer released for the Apple TV+ tv series starring Eva Longoria.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jpCqgonWyEc

BADLANDS---Elle Fanning is in talks to star in the next PREDATOR sequel with Dan Trachtenberg, who directed the PREY prequel. Reportedly, THE BADLANDS is set in the future.

Also, PREY 2 is in "early development" with Amber Midthunder returning.

GHOSTS OF TSUSHIMA---Hiroyuki Sanada (SHOGUN) is reportedly in talks to co-star in the Chad Stahelski movie based on the video game. Speculation is that Sanada will play Lord Shimura.

GODZILLA MINUS ONE---for the first time ever, the Academy Award-winning monster movie premiered at #1 simultaneously on streamers Netflix and iTunes VOD even though the two streamers did not advertise the movie beforehand.

IRON MAN---Robert Downey, Jr. commented on if he will return as Iron Man in a future Marvel project, “It’s just crazily in my DNA. Probably the most like-me character I’ve ever played, even though he’s way cooler than I am. I’ve become surprisingly open-minded to the idea.”

WAKE UP DEAD MAN: A KNIVES OUT MYSTERY---Josh Brolin is the latest cast addition to the Netflix murder mystery movie.

BLACK MIRROR---creator Charlie Brooker said Season 7 will include a sequel to the "U.S.S. Callister" episode, “You’ll see. Yeah, you’ll see. But we continue the story from where we left off. And there are some new characters as well. There is new stuff to do with where they’ve now ended up versus where they were."

LIKE A DRAGON: YAZUKA---Amazon Prime live-action tv series underway based on the LIKE A DRAGON and YAZUKA video games and will be set in 1995 and 2005. The plot involves “the life, childhood friends and the repercussions of the decisions of a fearsome and peerless Yakuza warrior with a strong sense of justice, duty, and humanity.”

TRIVIA---in THE NAKED GUN, Captain Ed Hocken's (George Kennedy) wife is named Ethel, but in the sequel, THE NAKED GUN 2 1/2: THE SMELL OF FEAR, Hocken's wife is named Edna.

In THE NAKED GUN, when Lieutenant Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) and Hocken are searching guests for concealed weapons at the reception for Queen Elizabeth, Drebin accidentally reaches into Hocken's pocket instead of the guest and finds Hocken's wallet with a picture of his wife, Ethel. Hocken thinks the guest is having an affair with Ethel, so he punches the guest out.

In THE NAKED 2 1/2: THE SMELL OF FEAR, Drebin says to Hocken, "Congratulations, I understand that Edna is pregnant again" and Hocken replies "Yes, and if I catch the guy who did it... "

In THE NAKED GUN, when Lieutenant Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) and Hocken are searching guests for concealed weapons at the reception for Queen Elizabeth, Drebin accidentally reaches into Hocken's pocket instead of the guest and finds Hocken's wallet with a picture of his wife, Ethel. Hocken thinks the guest is having an affair with Ethel, so he punches the guest out.

In THE NAKED 2 1/2: THE SMELL OF FEAR, Drebin says to Hocken, "Congratulations, I understand that Edna is pregnant again" and Hocken replies "Yes, and if I catch the guy who did it... "

WEDNESDAY, JUNE 5

ALIEN: ROMULUS---new trailer released for the movie starring Cailee Spaeny.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=92VYCjslw68

MAXXXINE---trailer released for the horror sequel starring Mia Goth.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y4GMm2-44-4

AVENGERS 5---Shawn Levy is Marvel Studio's "top choice" to direct the latest sequel. Inside sources claim the sequel could include over 60 MCU characters with Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo,

Benedict Cumberbatch, Tom Hiddleston, Simu Liu, Karen Gillian and others returning. Also, the sequel will emphasize an even balance among the characters compared to the previous movies which had emphasized a handful of characters leading the team.

MARVEL STUDIOS---Jordan Peele reportedly met with Marvel Studios to discuss directing a future Marvel movie.

HOSTEL---Paul Giamatti will star in the tv series based on the Eli Roth horror movies. The tv series is described as a "modern adaptation...reinvention" of the movies. Roth returns as co-writer/producer.

PEAKY BLINDERS---Cillian Murphy is returning for the Netflix movie that will be a sequel to the tv series. It reportedly might be set during World War II.

WAKE UP A DEAD MAN: A KNIVES OUT MYSTERY---Thomas Haden Church is the latest cast addition to the Netflix sequel.

PARAMOUNT---Paramount Global co-ceo Brian Robbins announced new spinoffs are underway, “In tv, new franchise extensions are coming for DEXTER, BILLIONS, and BLUE BLOODS."

ANT-MAN---Evangeline Lilly announced her retirement from acting, “Stepping away from what seems like the obvious choice (wealth and fame) can feel scary at times, but stepping into your dharma replaces the fear with fulfillment. I might return to Hollywood one day, but, for now, this is where I belong.”

TRIVIA---in the STAR TREK episode "Spectre of the Gun", starship Enterprise crewmen, including Dr. McCoy (DeForest Kelley), are transported into an an alien reenactment of the Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. In 1957, Kelley played Morgan Earp with Kirk Douglas and Burt Lancaster in GUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. CORRAL.

In the STAR TREK episode "Spectre of the Gun", starship Enterprise crewmen, including Dr. McCoy (DeForest Kelley), are transported into an an alien reenactment of the Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

In 1957, Kelley played Morgan Earp with Kirk Douglas and Burt Lancaster in GUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. CORRAL.

THURSDAY, JUNE 6

THE KILLER'S GAME---trailer released for the assassin movie starring Dave Bautista.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZHK6WghyWGY

ODDITY---trailer released for the horror movie.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tLNDvnv8B3A

THE LAST OF US----co-creator Craig Mazin said there might be a Season 4, “We don’t think that we’re going to be able to tell the story even within two seasons [2 and 3] because we’re taking our time and go down interesting pathways which we did a little bit in Season 1 too. We feel like it’s almost assuredly going to be the case that — as long as people keep watching and we can keep making more television — Season 3 will be significantly larger. And indeed, the story may require Season 4.”

SUPERMAN---new photo of James Gunn with cast members including Beck Bennett (second from right) who will play the DAILY PLANET 's brash sports reporter Steve Lombard.

MONSTER HIGH---Universal Pictures and Mattel are developing a live-action movie based on the doll line.

I AM LEGEND 2---Michael B. Jordan commented on the status of the sequel to the 2007 sci fi movie starring Will Smith, who returns for the sequel, “We’re still working on the script and getting that up to par. It doesn’t have a release date or anything like that. I’m not sure exactly where we’re going to be filming that one, but I’m really excited to get in front of the camera with him.

Being somebody that I’ve looked up to for a really long time, to be able to work with Will is something I’m really looking forward to. I’m really excited.”

THE MORNING SHOW---Marion Cotillard joins the Season 4 cast as Celine Dumont, a “savvy operator from a storied European family.”

THE BRIDE!---Jake Gyllenhaal will co-star in his sister Maggie Gyllenhaal's Frankenstein movie in an undisclosed role.

WATCH DOGS---Tom Blyth (THE HUNGER GAMES: THE BALLAD OF SONGBIRDS AND SNAKES ) and Sophie Wilde (TALK TO ME) will star in the movie based on the video game.

ATLAS---the Jennifer Lopez sci fi movie was Netflix's #1 movie for two straight weeks.

TRIVIA---movie trivia for the 80th anniversary of D-Day.

THE DIRTY DOZEN was the fourth-highest grossing movie of 1967 with a cast including Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, John Cassavetes, Telly Savalas, Donald Sutherland, Jim Brown, Clint Walker, Ernest Borgnine, George Kennedy, Ralph Meeker and Robert Ryan.

The movie was based on the E.M. Nathanson D-Day novel. Nathanson based his novel on a story he heard from sources, including his friend Russ Meyer, an Army combat photographer who later became famous for his soft porn movies. Meyer and others told Nathanson about a group of 12 Native American Army convicts, and their white lieutenant, who would be granted clemency if they agreed to participate in a suicidal mission behind German lines on D-Day.

Nathanson's research found the story to be fiction. In reality, The Filthy Thirteen were 13 paratroopers of the 101st Airborne Division who were chosen for seven days of additional grueling training. The squad leader was Jake "McNasty" McNiece, who told his men they would not bathe until they completed their training. After the training was completed, they were filthy which accounted for the "Filthy" part of their name.

McNiece explained how the unit's mythology included being convicts, "We never took care of our barracks or any other thing, or sanitation, and we were always restricted to camp. But we went AWOL every weekend that we wanted to and we stayed as long as we wanted till we returned back, because we knew they needed us badly for combat. And it would just be a few days in the brig. We stole jeeps. We stole trains. We blew up barracks. We blew down trees. We stole the colonel's whiskey and things like that."

The true story of The Filthy Thirteen was accurately reported by the STARS AND STRIPES newspaper, but later TRUE magazine's version of The Filthy Thirteen morphed into 12 Native American convicts who refused to bathe until they finished their training for their suicide mission and clemency.

Just before D-Day, McNiece, a part-Choctaw Indian, convinced his fellow paratroopers to shave their heads into Mohawk haircuts and apply face paint to reinforce their image as brave warriors. The Filthy Thirteen's Mohawks and face paint became a famous World War II photo.

On D-Day, of the 13 paratroopers, four were killed, four were wounded and two became POWs.

Filthy Thirteen member Jack Agnew told his daughter, Barbara, that 30% of the movie was accurate. She added, "Dad, when we were little kids, he'd always say, 'I won the war; I know you don't believe me, but someday you'll know."

THE DIRTY DOZEN was the fourth-highest grossing movie of 1967 with a cast including Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, John Cassavetes, Telly Savalas, Donald Sutherland, Jim Brown, Clint Walker, Ernest Borgnine, George Kennedy, Ralph Meeker and Robert Ryan.

The Filthy Thirteen's D-Day Mohawks and face paint became a famous World War II photo.

HOUSE OF THE DRAGON---showrunner Ryan Condal commented on the series' ending and how faithful it will be to George RR Martin's novel, “We’ve certainly talked about all that. We know where the ending is now. The writing team and I…and when I say the ending it’s really just where the curtain drops in this particular period of Targaryen history. Because, of course, after the Dance of Dragons is over there’s still another 120, 150 years of history before the Mad King is overthrown by Robert Baratheon. Which is really the end of the Targaryen Dynasty, and that leads us into the original series."

He added, “So yeah, we’ve talked about it. I do want to honor as much of what is there in the book, but we also have to find a satisfying to this story that wraps things up in a different and unexpected way for a giant TV audience. You’re always balancing the written history and making television show. But I think the fun of FIRE & BLOOD as a whole is it’s such a deeply rich and textured history that another writer can follow me after this and tell a story from the past before the DANCE OF THE DRAGONS or just after.”

BLADE---Wesley Snipes posted about the the reboot movie's turmoil in losing its second director.

STARFLEET ACADEMY---producer Alex Kurtzman commented on the prequel tv series starring Holly Hunter, “There’s a specific reason for that. As the father of a 17-year-old boy, I see what my son is feeling as he looks at the world and to his future. I see the uncertainty; I see all the things we took for granted as given are not certainties for him.

I see him recognizing he’s inheriting an enormous mess to clean up and it’s going to be on his generation to figure out how to do that, and that’s a lot to ask of a kid.

My thinking was, if we set STARFLEET ACADEMY in the halcyon days of the Federation where everything was fine, it’s not going to speak to what kids are going through right now. It’ll be a nice fantasy, but it’s not really going to be authentic.

What’ll be authentic is to set it in the timeline where this is the first class back after over 100 years, and they are coming into a world that is only beginning to recover from a cataclysm – which was the Burn, as established on STAR TREK: DISCOVERY, where the Federation was greatly diminished.

So they’re the first who’ll inherit, who’ll re-inherit, the task of exploration as a primary goal, because there just wasn’t room for that during the Burn – everybody was playing defense.”

DOCTOR WHO---showrunner Russell T. Davies commented on the show's low ratings, “In coming back, I wanted to make it simpler and I wanted to make it younger. Those two things are often not discussed – you read reactions to it and people are missing that. It’s simpler and younger – and it is working.

The under-16s and the 16-34 audience as well is massive. It’s not doing that well in the ratings, but it is doing phenomenally well with the younger audience that we wanted.”

He added, “They might not be the ratings we’d love. We always want higher. But they are building over the 28-day period. Episode one, ‘Space Babies,’ is already up to 5.6 million and counting. So it is getting there. And actually, I was brought back to bring in a younger audience. That’s been massively successful.

The audience no one ever gets are the under-30s. They just don’t watch television anymore. But those figures are astronomic for Doctor Who, it’s their top program in that bracket. I never thought it was possible, to be honest. But according to the people who juggle the numbers, all targets have been reached and exceeded. The BBC are running around like mad things.”

TRIVIA---in the opening credits for THE NAKED GUN 2 1/2: THE SMELL OF FEAR, the police car's flashing light is shown stopping Zsa Zsa Gabor's Rolls-Royce. Gabor gets out of her car, slaps the light and says, "This happens every f-cking time when I go shopping!" The scene was the spoof of the 1989 incident which became known as "The slap heard around the world" in which Beverly Hills police officer Paul Kramer stopped Gabor in her Rolls-Royce because of expired registration tags. While he was checking for other possible violations, Gabor drove off. Kramer stopped her again and then Gabor slapped Kramer. She claimed Kramer shoved her, but Kramer said the slap was unprovoked. Gabor was fined $2,350 for slapping Kramer, $352 for driving with an expired license and $235 for an open container of Jack Daniels.

In the subsequent trial, Gabor contradicted herself repeatedly on the witness stand, claimed Kramer had numerous gay lovers and claimed the police videotapes showing her using obscene language were doctored. Gabor said, “In Nazi Hungary they were fairer than here. Here they don’t kill you. They kill you with words.”

During the trial, the circus atmosphere included a Zsa Zsa impersonator having a mock fight with a man wearing a "Hang Zsa Zsa" t-shirt in the court building and a later bomb scare.

Los Angeles County District Atorney Ira Reiner said, “It started out as a minor incident. But what elevated this beyond . . . a minor case was her conduct over that three-week period during the trial where she made a mockery out of everything. And it wasn’t just a mockery of the criminal justice system . . . the judge, the police officers, the court personnel, the prosecutors, the entire system, which she dismissed as a Nazi-type system because anybody would presume to judge Zsa Zsa Gabor.”

At the end of the trial, the jury found guilty on all counts except for disobeying an officer. The judge fined Gabor $12,937, ordered her to spend three days in jail, perform 120 hours of community service and undergo a psychiatric evaluation.

Gabor commented on her sentence, “I’m disappointed. I can’t believe it. I can’t believe that in a country as great as ours that a 6-foot-4 policeman can beat up a lady of 5-foot-4 and use dirty language as if she was a street walker. I think Russia can’t be worse, or communist Hungary.”

She also commented on spending time in jail, “That would be wonderful. I’d have time to write my book...If I go to jail, Bistro Gardens [a restaurant] said they would serve me food three times a day.”

She also disclosed her immediate plans now that the trial was over, “I’m going home to collapse in my swimming pool.”

THURSDAY, JUNE 20

THE PENGUIN---teaser trailer released for the Max series starring Colin Farrell.

FLY ME TO THE MOON---trailer released for the comedy movie starring Scarlett Johansson and Channing Tatum.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TRs0vArcAOw

STARTREK: PRODIGY---trailer released for Season 2.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zXh5TLAeJqw

THE ABANDON---trailer released for the sci fi movie.

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KPrao47fD8A

REVELATIONS---director Yeon Sang-ho (TRAIN TO BUSAN) is developing a Netflix movie based on his Korean webtoon about a pastor who receives a divine revelation and teams up with a detective to find his abducted son. Alfonso Cuaron is the producer.

THE NIGHT MANAGER---in addition to Tom Hiddleston, Season 2 returning cast members include Olivia Colman as Angela Burr, Douglas Hodge as Rex Mayhew, Michael Nardone as Frisky and Noah Jupe as Danny (Daniel) Roper.

GREEN LANTERN---Jon Hamm said he turned down the starring role in the DC superhero GREEN LANTERN while he was doing MAD MEN, “That was one I definitely didn’t want to do.” He added that he wants to be part of the rival MCU, “It’s not like they were saying, 'We want you to be Iron Man.' But there were a lot of conversations, and I’m still in those. I talk to the guys that run Marvel and DC. And I’m a comic book nerd. So, we’ll see. Even that part of the industry is changing...But I’ve pitched myself for a couple parts of the Marvel Universe, I don’t want to say what exactly, but it was a part of a comic book that I really liked. I was like, “Are you going to do this story?” And they were like, 'Yeah, we’re actually thinking of that.' I go, 'Good. I should be the guy.' So maybe it’ll work out.”

THE X-FILES---David Duchovny commented on if he will return as Fox Mulder in the Ryan Coogler reboot movie, “I don’t wake up and wonder, ‘Where is the X-FILES stock today?’ But I love that show. I don’t know what my character would be like at my age. It’s an interesting question. That show can address the present as well as it addressed the ’90s. It just depends on [series creator] Chris [Carter] or the other writers. I’m always like, ‘Hey, let’s see.”

THE ADVENTURES OF TIN TIN 2---Andy Serkis commented on the status of the long-gestating Peter Jackson sequel, “definitely still working on it.”

NCIS---the spinoff with Michael Weatherly and Core de Pablo returning will have Tony DiNozzo and Ziva David on the run in Europe after DiNozzo's security company was attacked. Characters will include a“British nanny/bodyguard role,” a “Russian hacker extraordinaire” and a “French Interpol liaison". It will also feature Tony and Ziva’s preteen daughter, Tali.

TRIVIA---in the AIRPLANE! scene where the cockpit crew is sickened by the tainted fish and dragged from the cockpit, Captain Clarence Oveur (Peter Graves) is dragged down the aisle past a female passenger with long brown hair, who is on the right side of the aisle. Seconds later, stewardess Elaine says, "By the way, is there anyone on board who knows how to fly a plane?", which causes the passengers to panic, but the female passenger is now on the left side of the aisle.

In AIRPLANE!, stewardess Elaine tells the passengers there is a problem on the airliner.

Captain Clarence Oveur is dragged down the aisle past a female passenger with long brown hair, who is seated on the right side of the aisle.

Seconds later, Elaine says, "By the way, is there anyone on board who knows how to fly a plane?", which causes the passengers to panic---but the female passenger is now on the left side of the aisle.
